movies.title: Mars et Avril
movies.plot: Montreal, the future. Elderly jazz musician Jacob Obus (Jacques Languirand) still draws in audiences with his mesmerizing performances, playing instruments based on female models, designed by his much younger pal Arthur (Paul Ahmarani). The latest model, intriguing artist Avril (Caroline Dhavernas), entices both Arthur and Jacob. In the resulting love triangle, the old musician is ultimately victorious and appears to be in love for the first time in his life. But then Avril is accidentally transported to Mars, where the first manned mission just happened to land. Enter Eugène Spaak (Robert Lepage), inventor, cosmologist and Arthur's father, who unveils a new theory about man's desire to reach Mars and helps Jacob find the true meaning of life and love.
movies.simplePlot: Based on an acclaimed graphic novel, Mars & Avril is set in Montreal of the future, at the dawn of the first human landing on Mars, and tells the story of a musician who becomes obsessed with his muse.

biography.bio: Jacques Languirand was born on May 1, 1931 in Montréal, Québec, Canada as Jacques Dandurand. He is an actor and writer, known for Mars et Avril (2012), The Big Snake of the World (1999) and L'odyssée d'Alice Tremblay (2002).
biography.name: Jacques Languirand

biography.bio: Caroline Dhavernas commands the attention of filmgoers and television viewers with her beauty, talent and poise. Beginning her career at age 11, the Montreal native is already an acclaimed young actress who has also made her mark in Hollywood. She is the recipient of two Gemeaux Awards, one for "Best Interpretation in a Youth Series" for Zap (1993) and the second for "Best Supporting Role" in Tag (2000). She was also nominated for a Genie Award for "Best Supporting Actress" in Niagara Motel (2005). Dhavernas made her American television debut in 2004 in the critically acclaimed FOX series Wonderfalls (2004) and starred in the ABC television series Off the Map (2011). She appeared in the supernatural thriller Devil (2010) produced by M. Night Shyamalan, The Switch (2010) with Jennifer Aniston and Jason Bateman and can be seen in the film Wrecked (2009) starring Adrien Brody. She also starred as "Vera Keller" in The Pacific (2010), a mini-series about World War II that debuted on HBO in March 2010. Dhavernas appeared in the widely acclaimed Canadian feature Passchendaele (2008), which won the 2009 Genie Award for Best Motion Picture. Dhavernas also starred in the film Breach (2007), with Chris Cooper and Ryan Phillippe . In 2006 she starred in the Focus Features film Hollywoodland (2006) opposite Adrien Brody. Her first feature film, Thick as Thieves (1999), was followed by L'île de sable (1999). She also co-starred in English director Peter Greenaway's The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 1: The Moab Story (2003), which was presented at the Cannes Film Festival in 2003. Dhavernas divides her time between Montreal and New York City.
biography.name: Caroline Dhavernas

biography.bio: Paul Ahmarani was born in 1972 in Québec, Canada. He is an actor, known for Upside Down (2012), The Left-Hand Side of the Fridge (2000) and Congorama (2006).
biography.name: Paul Ahmarani

biography.bio: Robert Lepage is one of the foremost stage directors today and a leading figure in the Canadian avant garde, attracting particular attention for his multimedia-rich theatrical presentations as well as his innovative work with Shakespearian drama and opera.
biography.name: Robert Lepage

biography.bio: Jean Asselin is an actor, known for Mars et Avril (2012), Marguerite Volant (1996) and Bouscotte (1998).
biography.name: Jean Asselin

biography.bio: Stéphane Demers was born in 1966 in Montréal, Québec, Canada. He is an actor, known for Aviator (2004), Trudeau II: Maverick in the Making (2005) and Monsieur Lazhar (2011).
biography.name: Stéphane Demers

biography.bio: Jean Marchand was born on April 22, 1951 in Sorel, Quebec, Canada. He is known for his work on Unité 9 (2012), Special Delivery (1978) and Mars et Avril (2012).
biography.name: Jean Marchand

biography.bio: Kathleen Fortin is an actress, known for L'affaire Dumont (2012), Mars et Avril (2012) and Mommy Is at the Hairdresser's (2008).
biography.name: Kathleen Fortin

biography.bio: Marcel Sabourin was born on March 25, 1935 in Montréal, Québec, Canada. He is an actor and writer, known for Lilies (1996), J.A. Martin photographe (1977) and Another House (2013).
biography.name: Marcel Sabourin

biography.bio: André Montmorency was born on May 30, 1939 in Montréal, Québec, Canada. He was an actor and director, known for Mars et Avril (2012), Il était une fois dans l'est (1974) and Histoires d'hiver (1999). He died on July 5, 2016 in Montréal.
biography.name: André Montmorency

biography.bio: Gabriel Gascon was born on January 8, 1927 in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. He is an actor, known for Possible Worlds (2000), The Marsh (2002) and La vie fantôme (1992).
biography.name: Gabriel Gascon

biography.bio: Emanuel Hoss-Desmarais is an actor and director, known for Whitewash (2013), The Day After Tomorrow (2004) and Marius Borodine (2010).
biography.name: Emanuel Hoss-Desmarais

biography.bio: Pierre Leblanc is known for his work on Source Code (2011), The Day After Tomorrow (2004) and Polytechnique (2009).
biography.name: Pierre Leblanc

biography.bio: Richard Robitaille was born and raised in Montreal, Canada. He studied with the renowned Actor's Workshop held by Warren Robertson for three years. In 1998-1999 he's landed both english and french lead and principal roles in Feature films and highly acclaimed TV series. Richard presently moonlights between Montreal Toronto depending on the role.
biography.name: Richard Robitaille

biography.bio: Khanh Hua is an actor, known for Lilies (1996), The Left-Hand Side of the Fridge (2000) and Maelstrom (2000).
biography.name: Khanh Hua

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Imaging the Future Award - Special Mention

keywords: woman in love with two men
everything is not what it seems
